/home/mgh/LanlGeoMag/libLanlGeoMag/dqagie.f

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 *DECK DQAGIE
00002       SUBROUTINE DQAGIE (F, BOUND, INF, EPSABS, EPSREL, LIMIT, RESULT,
00003      +   ABSERR, NEVAL, IER, ALIST, BLIST, RLIST, ELIST, IORD, LAST)
00004 C***BEGIN PROLOGUE  DQAGIE
00005 C***PURPOSE  The routine calculates an approximation result to a given
00006 C            integral   I = Integral of F over (BOUND,+INFINITY)
00007 C            or I = Integral of F over (-INFINITY,BOUND)
00008 C            or I = Integral of F over (-INFINITY,+INFINITY),
00009 C            hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy
00010 C            ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I))
00011 C***LIBRARY   SLATEC (QUADPACK)
00012 C***CATEGORY  H2A3A1, H2A4A1
00013 C***TYPE      DOUBLE PRECISION (QAGIE-S, DQAGIE-D)
00014 C***KEYWORDS  AUTOMATIC INTEGRATOR, EXTRAPOLATION, GENERAL-PURPOSE,
00015 C             GLOBALLY ADAPTIVE, INFINITE INTERVALS, QUADPACK,
00016 C             QUADRATURE, TRANSFORMATION
00017 C***AUTHOR  Piessens, Robert
00018 C             Applied Mathematics and Programming Division
00019 C             K. U. Leuven
00020 C           de Doncker, Elise
00021 C             Applied Mathematics and Programming Division
00022 C             K. U. Leuven
00023 C***DESCRIPTION
00024 C
00025 C Integration over infinite intervals
00026 C Standard fortran subroutine
00027 C
00028 C            F      - Double precision
00029 C                     Function subprogram defining the integrand
00030 C                     function F(X). The actual name for F needs to be
00031 C                     declared E X T E R N A L in the driver program.
00032 C
00033 C            BOUND  - Double precision
00034 C                     Finite bound of integration range
00035 C                     (has no meaning if interval is doubly-infinite)
00036 C
00037 C            INF    - Double precision
00038 C                     Indicating the kind of integration range involved
00039 C                     INF = 1 corresponds to  (BOUND,+INFINITY),
00040 C                     INF = -1            to  (-INFINITY,BOUND),
00041 C                     INF = 2             to (-INFINITY,+INFINITY).
00042 C
00043 C            EPSABS - Double precision
00044 C                     Absolute accuracy requested
00045 C            EPSREL - Double precision
00046 C                     Relative accuracy requested
00047 C                     If  EPSABS.LE.0
00048 C                     and EPSREL.LT.MAX(50*REL.MACH.ACC.,0.5D-28),
00049 C                     the routine will end with IER = 6.
00050 C
00051 C            LIMIT  - Integer
00052 C                     Gives an upper bound on the number of subintervals
00053 C                     in the partition of (A,B), LIMIT.GE.1
00054 C
00055 C         ON RETURN
00056 C            RESULT - Double precision
00057 C                     Approximation to the integral
00058 C
00059 C            ABSERR - Double precision
00060 C                     Estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
00061 C                     which should equal or exceed ABS(I-RESULT)
00062 C
00063 C            NEVAL  - Integer
00064 C                     Number of integrand evaluations
00065 C
00066 C            IER    - Integer
00067 C                     IER = 0 Normal and reliable termination of the
00068 C                             routine. It is assumed that the requested
00069 C                             accuracy has been achieved.
00070 C                   - IER.GT.0 Abnormal termination of the routine. The
00071 C                             estimates for result and error are less
00072 C                             reliable. It is assumed that the requested
00073 C                             accuracy has not been achieved.
00074 C            ERROR MESSAGES
00075 C                     IER = 1 Maximum number of subdivisions allowed
00076 C                             has been achieved. One can allow more
00077 C                             subdivisions by increasing the value of
00078 C                             LIMIT (and taking the according dimension
00079 C                             adjustments into account).  However, if
00080 C                             this yields no improvement it is advised
00081 C                             to analyze the integrand in order to
00082 C                             determine the integration difficulties.
00083 C                             If the position of a local difficulty can
00084 C                             be determined (e.g. SINGULARITY,
00085 C                             DISCONTINUITY within the interval) one
00086 C                             will probably gain from splitting up the
00087 C                             interval at this point and calling the
00088 C                             integrator on the subranges. If possible,
00089 C                             an appropriate special-purpose integrator
00090 C                             should be used, which is designed for
00091 C                             handling the type of difficulty involved.
00092 C                         = 2 The occurrence of roundoff error is
00093 C                             detected, which prevents the requested
00094 C                             tolerance from being achieved.
00095 C                             The error may be under-estimated.
00096 C                         = 3 Extremely bad integrand behaviour occurs
00097 C                             at some points of the integration
00098 C                             interval.
00099 C                         = 4 The algorithm does not converge.
00100 C                             Roundoff error is detected in the
00101 C                             extrapolation table.
00102 C                             It is assumed that the requested tolerance
00103 C                             cannot be achieved, and that the returned
00104 C                             result is the best which can be obtained.
00105 C                         = 5 The integral is probably divergent, or
00106 C                             slowly convergent. It must be noted that
00107 C                             divergence can occur with any other value
00108 C                             of IER.
00109 C                         = 6 The input is invalid, because
00110 C                             (EPSABS.LE.0 and
00111 C                              EPSREL.LT.MAX(50*REL.MACH.ACC.,0.5D-28),
00112 C                             RESULT, ABSERR, NEVAL, LAST, RLIST(1),
00113 C                             ELIST(1) and IORD(1) are set to zero.
00114 C                             ALIST(1) and BLIST(1) are set to 0
00115 C                             and 1 respectively.
00116 C
00117 C            ALIST  - Double precision
00118 C                     Vector of dimension at least LIMIT, the first
00119 C                      LAST  elements of which are the left
00120 C                     end points of the subintervals in the partition
00121 C                     of the transformed integration range (0,1).
00122 C
00123 C            BLIST  - Double precision
00124 C                     Vector of dimension at least LIMIT, the first
00125 C                      LAST  elements of which are the right
00126 C                     end points of the subintervals in the partition
00127 C                     of the transformed integration range (0,1).
00128 C
00129 C            RLIST  - Double precision
00130 C                     Vector of dimension at least LIMIT, the first
00131 C                      LAST  elements of which are the integral
00132 C                     approximations on the subintervals
00133 C
00134 C            ELIST  - Double precision
00135 C                     Vector of dimension at least LIMIT,  the first
00136 C                     LAST elements of which are the moduli of the
00137 C                     absolute error estimates on the subintervals
00138 C
00139 C            IORD   - Integer
00140 C                     Vector of dimension LIMIT, the first K
00141 C                     elements of which are pointers to the
00142 C                     error estimates over the subintervals,
00143 C                     such that ELIST(IORD(1)), ..., ELIST(IORD(K))
00144 C                     form a decreasing sequence, with K = LAST
00145 C                     If LAST.LE.(LIMIT/2+2), and K = LIMIT+1-LAST
00146 C                     otherwise
00147 C
00148 C            LAST   - Integer
00149 C                     Number of subintervals actually produced
00150 C                     in the subdivision process
00151 C
00152 C***REFERENCES  (NONE)
00153 C***ROUTINES CALLED  D1MACH, DQELG, DQK15I, DQPSRT
00154 C***REVISION HISTORY  (YYMMDD)
00155 C   800101  DATE WRITTEN
00156 C   890531  Changed all specific intrinsics to generic.  (WRB)
00157 C   890831  Modified array declarations.  (WRB)
00158 C   890831  REVISION DATE from Version 3.2
00159 C   891214  Prologue converted to Version 4.0 format.  (BAB)
00160 C***END PROLOGUE  DQAGIE
00161       DOUBLE PRECISION ABSEPS,ABSERR,ALIST,AREA,AREA1,AREA12,AREA2,A1,
00162      1  A2,BLIST,BOUN,BOUND,B1,B2,CORREC,DEFABS,DEFAB1,DEFAB2,
00163      2  DRES,D1MACH,ELIST,EPMACH,EPSABS,EPSREL,ERLARG,ERLAST,
00164      3  ERRBND,ERRMAX,ERROR1,ERROR2,ERRO12,ERRSUM,ERTEST,F,OFLOW,RESABS,
00165      4  RESEPS,RESULT,RES3LA,RLIST,RLIST2,SMALL,UFLOW
00166       INTEGER ID,IER,IERRO,INF,IORD,IROFF1,IROFF2,IROFF3,JUPBND,K,KSGN,
00167      1  KTMIN,LAST,LIMIT,MAXERR,NEVAL,NRES,NRMAX,NUMRL2
00168       LOGICAL EXTRAP,NOEXT
00169 C
00170       DIMENSION ALIST(*),BLIST(*),ELIST(*),IORD(*),
00171      1  RES3LA(3),RLIST(*),RLIST2(52)
00172 C
00173       EXTERNAL F
00174 C
00175 C            THE DIMENSION OF RLIST2 IS DETERMINED BY THE VALUE OF
00176 C            LIMEXP IN SUBROUTINE DQELG.
00177 C
00178 C
00179 C            LIST OF MAJOR VARIABLES
00180 C            -----------------------
00181 C
00182 C           ALIST     - LIST OF LEFT END POINTS OF ALL SUBINTERVALS
00183 C                       CONSIDERED UP TO NOW
00184 C           BLIST     - LIST OF RIGHT END POINTS OF ALL SUBINTERVALS
00185 C                       CONSIDERED UP TO NOW
00186 C           RLIST(I)  - APPROXIMATION TO THE INTEGRAL OVER
00187 C                       (ALIST(I),BLIST(I))
00188 C           RLIST2    - ARRAY OF DIMENSION AT LEAST (LIMEXP+2),
00189 C                       CONTAINING THE PART OF THE EPSILON TABLE
00190 C                       WHICH IS STILL NEEDED FOR FURTHER COMPUTATIONS
00191 C           ELIST(I)  - ERROR ESTIMATE APPLYING TO RLIST(I)
00192 C           MAXERR    - POINTER TO THE INTERVAL WITH LARGEST ERROR
00193 C                       ESTIMATE
00194 C           ERRMAX    - ELIST(MAXERR)
00195 C           ERLAST    - ERROR ON THE INTERVAL CURRENTLY SUBDIVIDED
00196 C                       (BEFORE THAT SUBDIVISION HAS TAKEN PLACE)
00197 C           AREA      - SUM OF THE INTEGRALS OVER THE SUBINTERVALS
00198 C           ERRSUM    - SUM OF THE ERRORS OVER THE SUBINTERVALS
00199 C           ERRBND    - REQUESTED ACCURACY MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*
00200 C                       ABS(RESULT))
00201 C           *****1    - VARIABLE FOR THE LEFT SUBINTERVAL
00202 C           *****2    - VARIABLE FOR THE RIGHT SUBINTERVAL
00203 C           LAST      - INDEX FOR SUBDIVISION
00204 C           NRES      - NUMBER OF CALLS TO THE EXTRAPOLATION ROUTINE
00205 C           NUMRL2    - NUMBER OF ELEMENTS CURRENTLY IN RLIST2. IF AN
00206 C                       APPROPRIATE APPROXIMATION TO THE COMPOUNDED
00207 C                       INTEGRAL HAS BEEN OBTAINED, IT IS PUT IN
00208 C                       RLIST2(NUMRL2) AFTER NUMRL2 HAS BEEN INCREASED
00209 C                       BY ONE.
00210 C           SMALL     - LENGTH OF THE SMALLEST INTERVAL CONSIDERED UP
00211 C                       TO NOW, MULTIPLIED BY 1.5
00212 C           ERLARG    - SUM OF THE ERRORS OVER THE INTERVALS LARGER
00213 C                       THAN THE SMALLEST INTERVAL CONSIDERED UP TO NOW
00214 C           EXTRAP    - LOGICAL VARIABLE DENOTING THAT THE ROUTINE
00215 C                       IS ATTEMPTING TO PERFORM EXTRAPOLATION. I.E.
00216 C                       BEFORE SUBDIVIDING THE SMALLEST INTERVAL WE
00217 C                       TRY TO DECREASE THE VALUE OF ERLARG.
00218 C           NOEXT     - LOGICAL VARIABLE DENOTING THAT EXTRAPOLATION
00219 C                       IS NO LONGER ALLOWED (TRUE-VALUE)
00220 C
00221 C            MACHINE DEPENDENT CONSTANTS
00222 C            ---------------------------
00223 C
00224 C           EPMACH IS THE LARGEST RELATIVE SPACING.
00225 C           UFLOW IS THE SMALLEST POSITIVE MAGNITUDE.
00226 C           OFLOW IS THE LARGEST POSITIVE MAGNITUDE.
00227 C
00228 C***FIRST EXECUTABLE STATEMENT  DQAGIE
00229       EPMACH = D1MACH(4)
00230 C
00231 C           TEST ON VALIDITY OF PARAMETERS
00232 C           -----------------------------
00233 C
00234       IER = 0
00235       NEVAL = 0
00236       LAST = 0
00237       RESULT = 0.0D+00
00238       ABSERR = 0.0D+00
00239       ALIST(1) = 0.0D+00
00240       BLIST(1) = 0.1D+01
00241       RLIST(1) = 0.0D+00
00242       ELIST(1) = 0.0D+00
00243       IORD(1) = 0
00244       IF(EPSABS.LE.0.0D+00.AND.EPSREL.LT.MAX(0.5D+02*EPMACH,0.5D-28))
00245      1  IER = 6
00246        IF(IER.EQ.6) GO TO 999
00247 C
00248 C
00249 C           FIRST APPROXIMATION TO THE INTEGRAL
00250 C           -----------------------------------
00251 C
00252 C           DETERMINE THE INTERVAL TO BE MAPPED ONTO (0,1).
00253 C           IF INF = 2 THE INTEGRAL IS COMPUTED AS I = I1+I2, WHERE
00254 C           I1 = INTEGRAL OF F OVER (-INFINITY,0),
00255 C           I2 = INTEGRAL OF F OVER (0,+INFINITY).
00256 C
00257       BOUN = BOUND
00258       IF(INF.EQ.2) BOUN = 0.0D+00
00259       CALL DQK15I(F,BOUN,INF,0.0D+00,0.1D+01,RESULT,ABSERR,
00260      1  DEFABS,RESABS)
00261 C
00262 C           TEST ON ACCURACY
00263 C
00264       LAST = 1
00265       RLIST(1) = RESULT
00266       ELIST(1) = ABSERR
00267       IORD(1) = 1
00268       DRES = ABS(RESULT)
00269       ERRBND = MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*DRES)
00270       IF(ABSERR.LE.1.0D+02*EPMACH*DEFABS.AND.ABSERR.GT.ERRBND) IER = 2
00271       IF(LIMIT.EQ.1) IER = 1
00272       IF(IER.NE.0.OR.(ABSERR.LE.ERRBND.AND.ABSERR.NE.RESABS).OR.
00273      1  ABSERR.EQ.0.0D+00) GO TO 130
00274 C
00275 C           INITIALIZATION
00276 C           --------------
00277 C
00278       UFLOW = D1MACH(1)
00279       OFLOW = D1MACH(2)
00280       RLIST2(1) = RESULT
00281       ERRMAX = ABSERR
00282       MAXERR = 1
00283       AREA = RESULT
00284       ERRSUM = ABSERR
00285       ABSERR = OFLOW
00286       NRMAX = 1
00287       NRES = 0
00288       KTMIN = 0
00289       NUMRL2 = 2
00290       EXTRAP = .FALSE.
00291       NOEXT = .FALSE.
00292       IERRO = 0
00293       IROFF1 = 0
00294       IROFF2 = 0
00295       IROFF3 = 0
00296       KSGN = -1
00297       IF(DRES.GE.(0.1D+01-0.5D+02*EPMACH)*DEFABS) KSGN = 1
00298 C
00299 C           MAIN DO-LOOP
00300 C           ------------
00301 C
00302       DO 90 LAST = 2,LIMIT
00303 C
00304 C           BISECT THE SUBINTERVAL WITH NRMAX-TH LARGEST ERROR ESTIMATE.
00305 C
00306         A1 = ALIST(MAXERR)
00307         B1 = 0.5D+00*(ALIST(MAXERR)+BLIST(MAXERR))
00308         A2 = B1
00309         B2 = BLIST(MAXERR)
00310         ERLAST = ERRMAX
00311         CALL DQK15I(F,BOUN,INF,A1,B1,AREA1,ERROR1,RESABS,DEFAB1)
00312         CALL DQK15I(F,BOUN,INF,A2,B2,AREA2,ERROR2,RESABS,DEFAB2)
00313 C
00314 C           IMPROVE PREVIOUS APPROXIMATIONS TO INTEGRAL
00315 C           AND ERROR AND TEST FOR ACCURACY.
00316 C
00317         AREA12 = AREA1+AREA2
00318         ERRO12 = ERROR1+ERROR2
00319         ERRSUM = ERRSUM+ERRO12-ERRMAX
00320         AREA = AREA+AREA12-RLIST(MAXERR)
00321         IF(DEFAB1.EQ.ERROR1.OR.DEFAB2.EQ.ERROR2)GO TO 15
00322         IF(ABS(RLIST(MAXERR)-AREA12).GT.0.1D-04*ABS(AREA12)
00323      1  .OR.ERRO12.LT.0.99D+00*ERRMAX) GO TO 10
00324         IF(EXTRAP) IROFF2 = IROFF2+1
00325         IF(.NOT.EXTRAP) IROFF1 = IROFF1+1
00326    10   IF(LAST.GT.10.AND.ERRO12.GT.ERRMAX) IROFF3 = IROFF3+1
00327    15   RLIST(MAXERR) = AREA1
00328         RLIST(LAST) = AREA2
00329         ERRBND = MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(AREA))
00330 C
00331 C           TEST FOR ROUNDOFF ERROR AND EVENTUALLY SET ERROR FLAG.
00332 C
00333         IF(IROFF1+IROFF2.GE.10.OR.IROFF3.GE.20) IER = 2
00334         IF(IROFF2.GE.5) IERRO = 3
00335 C
00336 C           SET ERROR FLAG IN THE CASE THAT THE NUMBER OF
00337 C           SUBINTERVALS EQUALS LIMIT.
00338 C
00339         IF(LAST.EQ.LIMIT) IER = 1
00340 C
00341 C           SET ERROR FLAG IN THE CASE OF BAD INTEGRAND BEHAVIOUR
00342 C           AT SOME POINTS OF THE INTEGRATION RANGE.
00343 C
00344         IF(MAX(ABS(A1),ABS(B2)).LE.(0.1D+01+0.1D+03*EPMACH)*
00345      1  (ABS(A2)+0.1D+04*UFLOW)) IER = 4
00346 C
00347 C           APPEND THE NEWLY-CREATED INTERVALS TO THE LIST.
00348 C
00349         IF(ERROR2.GT.ERROR1) GO TO 20
00350         ALIST(LAST) = A2
00351         BLIST(MAXERR) = B1
00352         BLIST(LAST) = B2
00353         ELIST(MAXERR) = ERROR1
00354         ELIST(LAST) = ERROR2
00355         GO TO 30
00356    20   ALIST(MAXERR) = A2
00357         ALIST(LAST) = A1
00358         BLIST(LAST) = B1
00359         RLIST(MAXERR) = AREA2
00360         RLIST(LAST) = AREA1
00361         ELIST(MAXERR) = ERROR2
00362         ELIST(LAST) = ERROR1
00363 C
00364 C           CALL SUBROUTINE DQPSRT TO MAINTAIN THE DESCENDING ORDERING
00365 C           IN THE LIST OF ERROR ESTIMATES AND SELECT THE SUBINTERVAL
00366 C           WITH NRMAX-TH LARGEST ERROR ESTIMATE (TO BE BISECTED NEXT).
00367 C
00368    30   CALL DQPSRT(LIMIT,LAST,MAXERR,ERRMAX,ELIST,IORD,NRMAX)
00369         IF(ERRSUM.LE.ERRBND) GO TO 115
00370         IF(IER.NE.0) GO TO 100
00371         IF(LAST.EQ.2) GO TO 80
00372         IF(NOEXT) GO TO 90
00373         ERLARG = ERLARG-ERLAST
00374         IF(ABS(B1-A1).GT.SMALL) ERLARG = ERLARG+ERRO12
00375         IF(EXTRAP) GO TO 40
00376 C
00377 C           TEST WHETHER THE INTERVAL TO BE BISECTED NEXT IS THE
00378 C           SMALLEST INTERVAL.
00379 C
00380         IF(ABS(BLIST(MAXERR)-ALIST(MAXERR)).GT.SMALL) GO TO 90
00381         EXTRAP = .TRUE.
00382         NRMAX = 2
00383    40   IF(IERRO.EQ.3.OR.ERLARG.LE.ERTEST) GO TO 60
00384 C
00385 C           THE SMALLEST INTERVAL HAS THE LARGEST ERROR.
00386 C           BEFORE BISECTING DECREASE THE SUM OF THE ERRORS OVER THE
00387 C           LARGER INTERVALS (ERLARG) AND PERFORM EXTRAPOLATION.
00388 C
00389         ID = NRMAX
00390         JUPBND = LAST
00391         IF(LAST.GT.(2+LIMIT/2)) JUPBND = LIMIT+3-LAST
00392         DO 50 K = ID,JUPBND
00393           MAXERR = IORD(NRMAX)
00394           ERRMAX = ELIST(MAXERR)
00395           IF(ABS(BLIST(MAXERR)-ALIST(MAXERR)).GT.SMALL) GO TO 90
00396           NRMAX = NRMAX+1
00397    50   CONTINUE
00398 C
00399 C           PERFORM EXTRAPOLATION.
00400 C
00401    60   NUMRL2 = NUMRL2+1
00402         RLIST2(NUMRL2) = AREA
00403         CALL DQELG(NUMRL2,RLIST2,RESEPS,ABSEPS,RES3LA,NRES)
00404         KTMIN = KTMIN+1
00405         IF(KTMIN.GT.5.AND.ABSERR.LT.0.1D-02*ERRSUM) IER = 5
00406         IF(ABSEPS.GE.ABSERR) GO TO 70
00407         KTMIN = 0
00408         ABSERR = ABSEPS
00409         RESULT = RESEPS
00410         CORREC = ERLARG
00411         ERTEST = MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(RESEPS))
00412         IF(ABSERR.LE.ERTEST) GO TO 100
00413 C
00414 C            PREPARE BISECTION OF THE SMALLEST INTERVAL.
00415 C
00416    70   IF(NUMRL2.EQ.1) NOEXT = .TRUE.
00417         IF(IER.EQ.5) GO TO 100
00418         MAXERR = IORD(1)
00419         ERRMAX = ELIST(MAXERR)
00420         NRMAX = 1
00421         EXTRAP = .FALSE.
00422         SMALL = SMALL*0.5D+00
00423         ERLARG = ERRSUM
00424         GO TO 90
00425    80   SMALL = 0.375D+00
00426         ERLARG = ERRSUM
00427         ERTEST = ERRBND
00428         RLIST2(2) = AREA
00429    90 CONTINUE
00430 C
00431 C           SET FINAL RESULT AND ERROR ESTIMATE.
00432 C           ------------------------------------
00433 C
00434   100 IF(ABSERR.EQ.OFLOW) GO TO 115
00435       IF((IER+IERRO).EQ.0) GO TO 110
00436       IF(IERRO.EQ.3) ABSERR = ABSERR+CORREC
00437       IF(IER.EQ.0) IER = 3
00438       IF(RESULT.NE.0.0D+00.AND.AREA.NE.0.0D+00)GO TO 105
00439       IF(ABSERR.GT.ERRSUM)GO TO 115
00440       IF(AREA.EQ.0.0D+00) GO TO 130
00441       GO TO 110
00442   105 IF(ABSERR/ABS(RESULT).GT.ERRSUM/ABS(AREA))GO TO 115
00443 C
00444 C           TEST ON DIVERGENCE
00445 C
00446   110 IF(KSGN.EQ.(-1).AND.MAX(ABS(RESULT),ABS(AREA)).LE.
00447      1 DEFABS*0.1D-01) GO TO 130
00448       IF (0.1D-01.GT.(RESULT/AREA).OR.(RESULT/AREA).GT.0.1D+03
00449      1    .OR.ERRSUM.GT.ABS(AREA)) IER = 6
00450       GO TO 130
00451 C
00452 C           COMPUTE GLOBAL INTEGRAL SUM.
00453 C
00454   115 RESULT = 0.0D+00
00455       DO 120 K = 1,LAST
00456         RESULT = RESULT+RLIST(K)
00457   120 CONTINUE
00458       ABSERR = ERRSUM
00459   130 NEVAL = 30*LAST-15
00460       IF(INF.EQ.2) NEVAL = 2*NEVAL
00461       IF(IER.GT.2) IER=IER-1
00462   999 RETURN
00463       END
00464
